content: letsatsi crochet block designed by emmy de b page 1 of 8 information this block reminds me of the sun therefore the name latsetsi this is the sesotho name for the sun sesotho is the native language of the free state which is the central part of south africa this is a 9 ½ inch or 24 cm block worked in cotton but any yarn will do this would make a lovely afgan or baby blanket a table runner or cushion front materials nurturing fibres eco - cotton colours saffron vanilla lime willow pickled ginger sunkissed coral 4mm crochet hook abbreviations this pattern is written in us terminology chain chain slip_stitch slip_stitch space space cr space corner space lp loop single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet bphdc back post half_double_crochet page front post double_crochet together 3fptrtog 3 front post treble together 5 loop puff st 5 loop puff st special stitches 5lp puff st 5loop puff pull loop through the indicated stitch 5 times pull loop through all loops secure with single_crochet 3fpdctog 3 front post double_crochet together this is similar to a 3 dctog but work a front post double_crochet 3fptrtog 3 front post treble together this stitch will be explained in round 6 notes i like to use standing stitches to begin a round especially when i change colours but alternatively use chains to represent a stitch please note that the puff st is a 5 loop st and that the 1ch is to secure the loops the chain is part of the puff st that means that if the pattern asks for a chain after the puff st an additional chain should be made page 3 of 8 pattern round 1 saffron make 4 chain loop chain 2 counts as 1st half_double_crochet work 7 more half_double_crochet in loop slip_stitch in 2nd chain do not cut yarn stitch count 8 half_double_crochet round 2 saffron chain 1 work over the half_double_crochet from previous round into loop make 16 half_double_crochet in loop ending with a invisible join secure ends stitch count 16 half_double_crochet round 3 vanilla start in any st work 1 bphdc in next 16 sts slip_stitch in 1st st fasten_off and secure ends stitch count 16 bphdc round 4 sunkissed coral start in any st work 1 5lp puff 1 chain in next 16 sts slip_stitch in 1st puff fasten_off and secure ends stitch count 16 x 5lp puffs 16 chain round 5 lime start in any st work 1 fpdc around 5lp puff chain 3 in space work
